channel.title: Xbox 360 Questions
channel.description:
Well, since it's Christmas time I am planning on spending some money on an Xbox 360. I will be buying Live, etc. I am just wondering what I should buy with it.
First off, what Xbox 360 version should I buy? I can buy a bundle pack with 60GB, the Elite with 120GB, or I can buy the 360 refurbished, etc. I want the best quality.
Second, reccommend me some games. I know for sure already I will be getting MW2.
Questions:
How many times have YOU gotten the Red Ring of Death? This is my main concern when buying this. I know that you get a 3 year warranty, but after that you have to pay? There is also a guide on YT about fixing the RRoD manually, but I don't want to mess with it without having some information first about sending it in to Microsoft. I know that the most common cause of the RRoD is overheating. I heard an intercooler and the towel trick just make it worse. If I set my xbox 360 vertical and outside of cabinets so it can circulate cool air, etc. and have a small fan blow towards it, would that keep it cool enough to play for multiple hours a day?
If I want to play against other people on live, do I have to hook something up to my router or computer and have a long ass cord going halfway across my house?
I will take ANY reccommendations. I want good quality and information. Thanks! :)

item.title: Xbox 360 Questions
item.dc:creator: @runescapemod runescapemod
item.description:
@runescapemod wrote:

If you wan’t quality… Go for the cheepest one because no matter which x-box you they all the same… Just some have more memory than the other…
And if you have a wireless internet Connection then No you will not have a big ass wire going all the way threw your house… if ur internet is not wireless then yes you will…

Read full topic

item.title: Xbox 360 Questions
item.dc:creator: @Explisionist Explisionist
item.description:
@Explisionist wrote:

[quote=“Chassy13, post:57, topic:317414”][quote author=Explisionist link=topic=413950.msg3056122#msg3056122 date=1260487775]
Estimated priced isn’t just $500… The price of the elite is $399, it comes with mw2 a month of live, 1 controller, Ethernet cable, and a headset supposedly…

If you buy another control depending on the color about $20… 2 Other games about $20-50 ea, depending on the game… Also a inter cooler, it works as a better fan then the one in the 360 it helps you play for longer with out it getting really hot like they normally do… It’s price is $20
You will spend about…$460-$550… Its still around your price. Just include tax on all of it… But its all worth it.
[/quote]

Is this what you’re talking about, or is there a separate bundle version that costs $399?
http://www.walmart.com/catalog/product.do?product_id=13228495
I’m pretty sure that doesn’t come with the cable, etc. I’m not sure if our walmart around us even has a bundle like that.

Also most reviews I have seen on the intercooler have been negative against the product.[/quote]
I use the intercooler, and it works fine for me. But my Wal-Mart has the Elite with all the stuff it normally comes with, along with MW2 and a month of free live to test MW2.

Read full topic

about 15 pounds.

I got a turtle beach x3 headset for $80, it’s epic. I’m not sure how different it is from the x1 as I’ve never had one, so I can’t say what’s best.

Also, I doubt you’re going to find anything that cheap.[/quote]

anyway, what wud u suggest then?

item.title: Xbox 360 Questions
item.dc:creator: @Scape-JAVA Scape-JAVA
item.description:
@Scape-JAVA wrote:

[quote=“Chassy13, post:50, topic:317414”][quote author=The Reaper X link=topic=413950.msg3052266#msg3052266 date=1260155928]
Everyone complains about the vitality of the console. There have been many charts, polls, etc., concerning the Xbox 360’s problems. What they don’t mention is the fact that you can, if you’ve purchased the warranty, send in your Xbox with nearly any problem and they’ll fix it for free. My friends have also said that they’ve received free live gold membership because of their inconveniences. So don’t let the error rate push you away from a great console overall.
[/quote]

It’s not really the error rate anymore, it’s the wonder if 500-550 dollars is worth it.[/quote]

It is believe me.

Read full topic

item.title: Xbox 360 Questions
item.dc:creator: @iKapa iKapa
item.description:
@iKapa wrote:

[quote=“xxlukexx, post:47, topic:317414”][quote author=iKapa link=topic=413950.msg3052723#msg3052723 date=1260208514]
I bought an old Xbox 360 (The one were 20gb was the main storage device) and I’ve had it for a year, playing constantly. I’m hoping to get a bigger HDD so I’d suggest going for atleast the Premium (60GB HDD).

As for RRoD. Played a year, constantly no RRoD (Apart from when I spilled milk over the damn power adapter :()
[/quote]

You drink milk?[/quote]

No. I was having cereal upstairs.

item.title: Xbox 360 Questions
item.dc:creator: @the1337legend the1337legend
item.description:
@the1337legend wrote:

[quote=“Chassy13, post:36, topic:317414”]I did some math here, and if the internet connection works after moving the router:

For:

[ul][li]The Elite[/li]
[li]Another wireless controller[/li]
[li]2 games[/li]
[li]ethernet cable[/li]
[li]12 months of Gold live(not getting the chat pack version, seems worthless to me)[/li][/ul]

Will cost around 500 USD.

Anything else I need? I have a headset already. I’m going to stick to these two games until I save up some money. These 2 should keep me entertained for months, and then I will see what other games I want to buy.[/quote]

i paid just that for my arcade bundle about 2 and a half years ago.
when i mean arcade bundle i mean
xbox arcade
256 mb card.
one controller.

and a box to put them all in.

Read full topic

item.title: Xbox 360 Questions
item.dc:creator: @The_Chubby_Bunny The Chubby Bunny
item.description:
@The_Chubby_Bunny wrote:

[quote=“xxlukexx, post:40, topic:317414”][quote author=The Chubby Bunny link=topic=413950.msg3051627#msg3051627 date=1260125064]
I’ve had mine since '06, gotten 2 rrods, but i just rebooted my xbox and it was fine.

Games: Gta 4 is fun, do not get gow 2, it is a complete fucking joke. Don’t bother with halo 3 if your getting mw2. Good rpgs are Oblivion and Fallout 3, oblivion is better because it’s more immersive. Get rechargable battery packs for your controllers, won’t have to worry about double a’s. Turtle beach x1’s are $60 headsets, they plug into your 360 and your tv, and have AMAZING quality. I’ve tried them out with mw2, and it’s insane, everything sounds way different with them. They also cancel out most noise, so you won’t hear someone if there calling you.

You can hook up netflix with your xbox so you can stream movies on it, all free with subscription too.
[/quote]

recharagable battery packs?
i use a lead that leads up to my xbox when the controller is almost out of battery… a few hrs and you can use it for like, 5 hr +…[/quote]

same shit

You can find a wireless adaptor for your xbox for $35, don’t pull a dumbass move like me and buy the xbox one for $100

Read full topic

item.title: Xbox 360 Questions
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

Whatever you do I would suggest looking at gamecrawler for your games, I have found some ridiculously good deals here.

TabbyKiller:

Dont get Prototype or INFAMOUS they get very boring. Cool for like 1 week and boring for like the rest of you life.

Infamous is a ps3 exclusive, and warning him not to get prototype because it gets boring quick is a bit ridiculous when you list L4D2 ANNNNNNND Assasins Creed 2. Ok, that was a bit unfair, I haven’t played Assasins Creed 2 but if it is ANYTHING like the original then the charm won’t last a week.

Read full topic

item.title: Xbox 360 Questions
item.dc:creator: @I_Yaa_I I Yaa I
item.description:
@I_Yaa_I wrote:

I got the Refurbished Pro… It’s just like new, and it costs 199 99. Mine came with a free month of xbox live, but I have it for free because my friend gave me a code. If you worry about the RROD get an Xbox 360 cooler, I forgot the name thought.

Xbox 360 Refurbished = 216.50(around that, 216 is the amount of dollars), cod 4 Pre Owned = 27 99.

244 bucks for everything a pro includes and a game, the xbox cooler is 20 bucks so thats 264

Read full topic
